intro: Kedrostis macrosperma, commonly known as the African giant watermelon, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces large, pale green fruits with a thick, fibrous rind and sweet, juicy flesh. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The plant is often cultivated for its edible fruit and has historical use in traditional medicine.
